intro: Verbesina mameana, commonly known as the Mexican beggar's ticks, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant produces small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Verbesina mameana is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields, and it can spread through its sticky, seed-bearing structures.
